newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Zimbabwe cell phone craze interrupts parliament.
newsitem.headline: Zimbabwe cell phone craze interrupts parliament.

text.p: Zimbabwean parliamentary business was briefly interrupted on Wednesday by the latest craze to hit the southern African country, the mobile cellular telephone, when it tinkled away in the midst of debate.
The house's deputy speaker Edna Madzongwe immediately called the house to order and ruled that legislators with the prized gadgets should switch them off when parliament is in session.
The ruling was hardly out of her mouth when another cellular phone shrilled away, inciting laughter from the parliamentarians.
The mobile cellular telephone made its debut in Zimbabwe last year.
